CLOSE MENU
CALL CENTER:
800-339-4661
In-Home Supportive Services (IHSS)
Services
IHSS helps seniors and disabled people with basic needs such
 as:
Bathing and grooming
Dressing
Cleaning the
 house
Shopping
Laundry
Making meals
Who May Apply
To get IHSS, you need to:
Meet financial eligibility guidelines
Be blind,
 disabled, or age 65 or older
Meet full-scope requirements
 for Medi-Cal
AND be unable to live at home safely without
 help
Financial eligibility:
People with Supplemental Security Income/State Supplementary
 Payment (SSI/SSP)
People without SSI/SSP may qualify but
 may need to pay part of the costs
How to Apply
You or someone you know may apply for you.
If you apply for a person under 18, apply using the minor's information.
Online
Professionals, such as hospital discharge planners, may make a
 referral online. New users must first register at the
HHSA
 Web Portal
then submit referral at the
IHSS/Case
 Management Portal
.
Phone
Call
(800) 339-4661
to apply with Call Center staff.
Email
Email the
IHSS
 application
to:
AIS.295only.HHSA@sdcounty.ca.gov
All other forms go to your social worker.
Mail or In Person
You can visit or
 send your
IHSS
 application
to one of these IHSS Offices:
IHSS Office
Address
El Cajon
389 N. Magnolia Avenue
El Cajon, CA 92020
Escondido
649 W. Mission Avenue Ste.5
Escondido, CA 92025
National City
401 Mile of Cars Way Ste.210
National City, CA 91950
Oceanside
3708 Ocean Ranch Boulevard
 Ste.320
Oceanside, CA 92056
Overland
5560 Overland Avenue Ste.310
San Diego, CA 92123
Southeastern Live Well Center
5101 Market Street Ste.2100
San Diego, CA 92114
We can print an application at any of our offices.
Fax
Fax the
IHSS
 application
to
(619) 344-8077
.
All other forms go to your IHSS worker.
After You Apply
The IHSS worker will make an appointment to meet you at your
 home.
The IHSS worker will talk with you about your medical
 condition, living arrangements, and help you get from your family,
 friends, or others.
The IHSS worker will also talk with you
 more about services you need and how often.
A healthcare
 professional must complete a certification for you about your
 medical condition and need for services.
The IHSS worker
 will send you a Notice of Action informing you if you qualify for
 services, what services you qualify for, and if you have a share of
 cost.
Time Sheets
You may approve time sheets online using the
Electronic Service
 Portal
or by phone using the Telephone Timesheet System.
More information on
EVV
 for recipients and providers
.
Get Involved
IHSS/Public Authority Advisory Committee
Visit the
IHSS/Public Authority
 Advisory Committee
site to join and become a member.
